text: <!channel>: Hey team! Please send me your lunch orders (Boke) by 10:45am so that everything can be ordered together.
<!channel>: Speak now or forever eat your leftovers!
did you get my DM?
yes, jenny!
got yours and scott's and matt's
no boke for me, thanks though!
Those of you who ordered food - it's on the walnut table!
cool

<!channel>: thinking about "jump to top"... We could introduce a new floating button / icon, (probably at the bottom), but I'm wondering what we can do with what we already have. Two ideas:
>Use the Status bar area: I know we dont have one, but can we use that 20px area, maybe a double tap to scroll to top?
or
>Use the Triangle Flag: If scrolled down, first tap scrolls back to top, then second tap opens the menu. I think this holds up because the user can always "swipe" to open the nav.
Thoughts?

if we do scroll to top on the activity feed, conceivable we want that for the whole app...   so think about how that applies to the message list or the thread within a message (scroll to bottom, not top?) or even just the address book.
<@U0289USNA> where are you?
in a meeting...
I'll be there in 10
k no hurry
ok - maybe 15 then
could we just use the status bar area? obviously transparent so content slides underneath? <http://cl.ly/image/0s0o2b3J2M1u>
I think the question is just wether or not that is truly tappable..  20 pixels is tight for a tappable region but I would be inclined to try it if works for everyone else.
do apps like instagram / twitter expand that?
twitter lets you hit the entire nav bar, but instagram keeps it to the 40/20px status bar area. feels tappable enough for me
<!channel>: designs and comp are up on Trello for circle changes. New column called "changes"
and spec
Looks great! Thank you.
<@U02AUNA0P>: and <@U026PLK4S> do you guys have an update on the new loader idea? I'd love to get that in front of Ewald and then over to the client.
personally, i do not. I could see a solution taking a bit more time though
i dont know how Phillip is tracking
working on a little something for the image loader right now. not sure how it's gonna turn out, but still working on it
Do you have at ETA, Phillip? I don't want to send it over before it's ready, but do want to get feedback on the concept before we put a lot of hours into it
i wanna say i'll have the animation done sometime within the next hour
more sooner than later though
that sounds great
<@U02613K0X>: <@U0289USNA> just checked in an update to the networking connector in iOS to support jenny's changes so we can load activity feed by tag
ok.
btw...  I just replicated Mary's black screen of death.
I crashed and am now stuck in it.
is that with latest changes?
i found a really dumb situation where if you failed refreshing users you could end up with a VC-less window

great!
right, he did ...  hang on.

<@U02688JHZ> I did, and I sent it to David to look at.
